DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Epirubicin hydrochloride is a type of antibiotic called an anthracycline that is used as a chemotherapy drug. It stops cells from copying their DNA and from making RNA and proteins. This slows or stops the growth of cancer cells and other rapidly growing cells.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Epirubicin hydrochloride is approved to be used with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Breast cancer. It is used after surgery in patients whose cancer has spread to the lymph nodes under the arm.

Section.Para: Epirubicin hydrochloride is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
